name: Comfort Inn Rochester/Brighton

reviews.text: We stayed on a Thursday night to go to RIT. The price was great and while not the closest to the university (it took us just over 10 minutes), it was in a convenient location, near several restaurants and many shopping options.
reviews.title: Good Value. Less than 15 minutes to RIT.

reviews.text: It is not perfect - no elevator, some light stains on the popcorn ceiling, and hot breakfast could use a little work - but all in all a reasonable value. Room was small, but it was very clean.
reviews.title: Nice, clean room at least, I mean last.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the staff, just not particularly enthusiastic. I really prefer a bright, upbeat person to greet me.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: I stayed here while visiting my daughters over their fall break. My room was very nice, the bed are comfy, but the sink is outside the bathroom just to the right of the entry door. You can't really use the sink without being exposed to the world if someone leaves or enters the room. I had two issues with this hotel. We left the hotel for several hours expecting our room to be cleaned when we returned. No. I called the front desk and was told that the housekeeper were still working on the rooms. We left again and returned 3 hours later and the room had not been touched. I then asked the housekeeper directly if she was going to clean my room. She appeared at the door about 45 minutes later and asked me what I wanted her to do. Really?
reviews.title: Nice property for an ovenight stay

reviews.text: We had no clean towels, the bathroom had not been cleaned, etc. It was just bizarre. I mentioned this to the manager and the next day the room was immaculate when we returned. I gave this hotel another chance before I wrote a review because the last time I stayed here I overheard the manager cursing-f bombs and all (he was in the breakfast room and didn't realize I was there). We also had trouble with the AC, but that's another story.
reviews.title: Perfect Experience

reviews.text: I stayed for one week and had a very restful stay. I did forget about the pool, so I do not have a review on that. But, I am booking again for my next work visit. The bed was very comfortable, the hotel is small and the atomsphere very peaceful. I did not have loud guests. The hotel is close to great shopping, the staff was pleasant always. The hotel was very clean. I liked the iron in my room it was higher quality than most for ironing work out fits. I am a very low maintenance guest, everything was very smooth from check in to check out. And the staff was very knowledgeable about travel routes, attractions, traffic, restaurants, whatever I needed. The computer station worked well also. Parking was good also, I never had trouble getting a close spot to the entrances.
reviews.title: Very Satisfied

reviews.text: Stayed for one week during August 2012. The hotel is small and compact but well kept and every thing worked. There really inst much to say about the hotel other than it was very forgettable and i am struggling to recall it and i checked out 48 hours ago. Good tv channel selection. OK breakfast only down side the beds are a little short and my feet hung over the edge.
reviews.title: 1 week

reviews.text: All in all i would stay again, if i was in the area.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed just the one night and based our decision on reviews from Trip Adviser guest recommendations. It was an excellent choice from the point of price and location [it is a relatively short drive to the new Eastview super mall in nearby Victor] and would have rated 100% on all counts were it not for one ‘black’ mark - the apparent water damaged ceiling in our room [reference photo]. I do not know if this is the only 2nd floor room affected but it was very surprising as the motel is otherwise pristine. The discoloration may be only cosmetic but the concern for mould was a potential health issue for us. To be fair, we used the express checkout so did not report the matter to the front desk or request a room change. Notwithstanding, we would definitely stay there again and recommend same to our friends and other Trip Adviser followers.
reviews.title: Small but nice

reviews.text: This hotel is small in many ways - the total number of rooms, and the space in each room. However, the rooms have good furnishings and fixtures (fridge, microwave, iron/board, internet, etc) and some higher quality touches (granite countertop, tile and granite in shower). The place was either new or recently renovated, and that quality showed. Good breakfast downstairs, with 2 types of batter for waffle maker (blueberry and regular), eggs & sausage.
reviews.title: "Comfort" Inn is not just a catchy name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was clean, comfortable, a good value for the price paid. The room was good sized, the beds terrific, the bathroom clean, the amenities just right and the breakfast fresh and good. We drive through this area regularly and will certainly return here.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been nicer

reviews.text: This is a great little hotel. Great price and great service. Breakfast included, continental. Rooms are clean. Hair dryer, shampoo and conditioner. Reception friendly and helpful. Cracker Barrel right next store for breakfast, lunch or dinner. You also have the option to workout at the gym at the Homewood Suites next door.
reviews.title: Wonderful Lil' Gem

reviews.text: I traveled to Rochester recently for business where the client booked a room for me at the Comfort Inn. To be honest, I have never stayed at a Comfort Inn nor have I chosen to stay at a 2-star rated facility.
reviews.title: 2-Star Rated hotel in a 3-Star Body

reviews.text: I must say that upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean and looks relatively new. It is in the perfect location as there are local restaurants along the main road, including shopping, with better chain restaurants a few minutes away. Traffic can get heavy at times, making left turns out of their drive slightly risky.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: The lobby/breakfast area reminds me of a Hilton or Marriott property, albeit smaller. I arrived later in the evening. The person on staff was pleasant. The facility only has two floors and there is no elevator. I find that to be odd but assumed this was a cost saving move. I would have hated to be on the second floor with baggage as that would have been a nuisance.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a weekend getaway; but hope your neighbour doesn't make a lot of noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never having stayed in a Comfort Inn before, this one would persuade us to again without hesitation. Our room was large and, although next to a main road, silent. Friendly staff and a well above average (free) breakfast provided in comfortable surroundings. Free wifi, easy parking and a range of places to eat nearby made this a great pick. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.text: I had 2 rooms for 1 night. This is easy to find off I590 & there are several places to eat close by. The wireless internet worked fine & there were refrigerators & microwaves in our rooms. Breakfast was very good with blueberry waffle mix, sausage, scrambled eggs & other hot items available in addition to the normal cold items. The staff was very friendly & the hotel was well kept. This is one of the better value hotels I have stayed in.
reviews.title: A great value place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on Sept 5th with my daughter and son (2 rooms) in King and double. Adjoining rooms not possible in that configuration as all Kings on one side of the hall and doubles the other. They placed us across the hall from each other as per our prior online request. Comfortable beds, desk and free Wifi welcome. Refrigerator, hairdryer, ironing board, HD TV, clock radio, no room safe. Toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, soap and body lotion, no shower caps, though I suppose I could have asked for one at reception. The bathroom was clean and consisted of a toilet and bath/shower combination. The sink was in the room itself. Towels were fluffy and soft and plentiful. Linens on the bed were soft. Quiet room, except for the neighbour's alarm which went off every few minutes throughout the morning I was trying to relax before departure and when I asked. the maid told me she couldn't touch a guest's personal items to shut it off.
reviews.title: Comfort is the true description

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was a step up from basic (I certainly wouldn't describe it as "spectacular" like a previous guest), the danish were small and hard, the muffins tiny and unfortunately had nuts which I couldn't eat (when are people going to clue in that nuts should not be a regular ingredient in food nowadays?). The yogurt was low cal (aspartame). There was bread for toasting, bagels, boiled eggs, sausages, juices and sugary cereals and some whole fruit in baskets. I didn't try these so can't review taste.Tables and breakfast set up were in the lobby part of the hotel.
reviews.title: The Best Rest for Less

reviews.text: All in all, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable room at a good value this is a good choice for you. We paid $75.00 per room plus tax on the CAA/AAA rate.
reviews.title: Won't Stay Again

description: Forty-three deluxe guest rooms. Complimentary continental breakfast. Fitness center. Business center.
